title: Which one is better - MBA or PGDM from Canada? - Quora

response.answer_text: With the rise of corporate culture and Entrepreneurship, more students are now opting for management studies in prestigious B-schools. Also, there is no lack of institutes and universities offering postgraduate and Master’s programs in management. In fact, almost all management institutes in abroad offering a wide range of courses all under the same academic scale. However, Indian students often find themselves confused with the choice of two such courses, namely MBA and PGDM. In Canada, PGDM and an MBA are quite different. PGDM is a 2-year diploma program, while MBA is a full-fledged degree. In terms of the academic value of a Canadian PGDM, it will be low compared to Canadian MBA programs. The average Mba salary in Canada is $72,558 per year . Entry-level positions start at $27,121 per year while most experienced workers make up to $102,338 per year. Although there are similarities between the curriculum of both, differences exist as well. A student pursuing MBA will be studying more of the theoretical aspects of management. An MBA institute will be following a fixed curriculum as it will be based on the university guidelines. A student enrolled in PGDM course will be gaining knowledge regarding soft skills and the programme is more industry-oriented. A non-deemed institute does not have to follow university standards, so it is free to change its academic curriculum according to industry standards and subsequently change in the business environment. The programme will prepare you for a senior-level position in an organisation. Advantages of pursuing a degree in Business from Canada: MBA colleges in Canada are affordable and provide internationally recognized degrees.Business programs by Canadian colleges enhance the career opportunities and earning potentials of students.Institutions here focus majorly on increasing the knowledge base and help students explore all the disciplines of the business world.Students get an opportunity to build strong relations with fellow mates belonging to different cultural and social backgrounds.The course curriculum at Canadian institutions includes internship programs. These help students work in the real business world and gain better insights into the industry they'll be working in.Many PG diploma programs come with co-options, which mean you get an opportunity to intern or work with various industries and companies. If you’re interested in building constructive relationships with employers and other people, a PG diploma could be what you need. It will not only help you to find job, but also helps you to gain a PR to settle in the country. Now, will discuss about Canadian colleges and institutes which offer PGDM and MBA courses.
